definitions.definition: to put or spread something over something, or to lie on the surface of something:
examples: The light was so bright that I had to cover my eyes.

definitions.definition: something that is put on or over something else, usually to protect it, to keep something in, etc.:
examples: I keep my computer printer under a protective plastic cover.

definitions.definition: the stiff outside part of a book or magazine, usually made of thick paper or cardboard:
examples: Who should we put on the cover of the magazine this month?

definitions.definition: to read a book, magazine, etc. all the way through from the beginning to the end
to send something in a plain/separate envelope
the blankets, sheets, etc. on a bed:
examples: Martha threw back the covers and bounced out of bed.
